searchDocs.title: Intro
searchDocs.content: Intro Welcome to Jaylen's TweenModule Documentation! Here, you'll learn on how to use some of the functions from this beautifully built TweenModule! NOTICE! This TweenModule is for anyone, including Beginners. If need of any anything, check out the helpful links below! Jaylen's TweenModule TutorialTweenModule Asset

searchDocs.title: TweenInfo: String or Instance​
searchDocs.content: info All functions in TweenModule accept either a TweenInfo object or a TweenInfo string.

searchDocs.title: Option 1: TweenInfo.new​
searchDocs.content: You can use the default TweenInfo like this:  TweenModule.Move(workspace.Part, TweenInfo.new(1, Enum.EasingStyle.Sine, Enum.EasingDirection.Out), Vector3.new(0, 5, 0), true)

searchDocs.title: Option 2: TweenInfo String Profile Format​
searchDocs.content: You can also pass a string with this format:  <EasingStyle><EasingDirection>:[Duration]:[RepeatCount]:[Reverses]:[DelayTime]   Please note <> means required & [] means optional.  Example​  TweenModule.Color(workspace.Model, "QuadInOut:1.5:0:true:0", Color3.fromRGB(255, 100, 100))   This uses Enum.EasingStyle.Quad and using Enum.EasingDiection.InOut for 1.5 seconds, does not repeat, reverses once, and has no delay.

searchDocs.title: Getting Started
searchDocs.content: Getting Started Before doing anything with your code, you need to identify TweenModule. local TweenModule = require(Path.To.TweenModule) Are you using this TweenModule for TRIA.os and receiving an error about a Script not implementing Runtime? If you're using this specifically for TRIA.os, go to the TweenModule and put this on line 1 require(game:GetService("ServerScriptService").Runtime):Init() If it still doesn't work, please check for any of your scripts that doesn't have Runtime on line 1.

searchDocs.title: Group Tweens
searchDocs.content: Group Tweens Group multiple models or parts into one controller: local Groups = TweenModule.Groups local MyFavoriteUnbiasedGroup = Groups.new(workspace.Model1, workspace.Model2) MyFavoriteUnbiasedGroup:Move("SineInOut:2", CFrame.new(0, 5, 0), true) MyFavoriteUnbiasedGroup:Color("OutBounce:1", Color3.fromRGB(0, 255, 0)) MyFavoriteUnbiasedGroup:Add(workspace.Model3) MyFavoriteUnbiasedGroup:Remove(workspace.Model1) info All the functions you use for Models, Folders, & BaseParts, they work with groups. The only change is that instead of using .Move, it would be :Move, and you don't have to identify the target or instance, they're already defined by the group, this is the same for the other functions.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: since 2.0.0 </> GroupHandler.new(...: Instance ) → GroupHandler Creates a new group tween handle that allows tweening multiple instances together.

searchDocs.title: Add​
searchDocs.content: </> GroupHandler:Add(...: Instance ) → () Adds instances to the group.

searchDocs.title: Remove​
searchDocs.content: </> GroupHandler:Remove(...: Instance ) → () Removes instances from the group.

searchDocs.title: How do I use the TweenModule?
searchDocs.content: How do I use the TweenModule? Welcome to Jaylen's TweenModule — a powerful and flexible tweening utility for Roblox that supports: Custom easing profile strings like "SineOut:1.5:0:true:0"Group tweening for multiple models or partsFolder support (folders are treated like models)Built-in utility functions like .Move, .Color, .Scale, .Rotate, .Shake, and more To see ALL available functions, go to the API page. To understand more of this TweenModule Go to the next page to get started on how to use it!

searchDocs.title: Tween by Tag​
searchDocs.content: Tween anything tagged with CollectionService:  TweenModule.TweenTag("Tweenable", "ElasticOut:2", { Transparency = 0.5 })

searchDocs.title: Chain Tweens​
searchDocs.content: Play multiple tweens one after the other:  TweenModule.ChainTween({ { instance = workspace.Part1, tweenInfo = "SineOut:1", props = { Transparency = 0.2 } }, { instance = workspace.Part1, tweenInfo = "SineIn:1", props = { Transparency = 1 } }, }, function() print("Finished chain!") end)

searchDocs.title: Color Support​
searchDocs.content: Supports:  Color3BrickColorHex strings like "#ff0000"  TweenModule.Color(workspace.Part, "QuadOut:1", BrickColor.new("Bright blue")) TweenModule.Color(workspace.Part, "OutElastic:1", "#FFB6C1")

searchDocs.title: Beam / Curve Tweening​
searchDocs.content: TweenModule.SequenceTween(workspace.MyBeam, "SineInOut:2", { Color = ColorSequence.new(Color3.new(1, 0, 0), Color3.new(0, 0, 1)), CurveSize0 = 2, }, true)

searchDocs.title: Shake​
searchDocs.content: TweenModule.Shake(workspace.Part, 2, 5, false)   Shakes a part for 2 seconds at intensity 5. Use -1 for infinite shake (stop manually).

searchDocs.title: Scale​
searchDocs.content: TweenModule.Scale(workspace.Model, "SineOut:1", Vector3.new(2, 2, 2), true, false)   adjustPosition = true: Moves part as it scales.scaledByModel = true: Preserves relative offsets inside the model.

searchDocs.title: Move​
searchDocs.content: since 1.0.0 </> TweenModule.Move( target: PVInstance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, movement: CFrame | Vector3 , byPivot: boolean ) → TweenHandle Moves a PVInstance (Model, Folder, or BasePart) to a new position using tweens. Example: local Part = workspace.MyPart local Model = workspace.MyModel -- Move a part upward by 10 studs over 1 second TweenModule.Move(Part, "QuadOut:1", Vector3.new(0, 10, 0), false) -- Move a model forward relative to its pivot TweenModule.Move(Model, "SineInOut:2", CFrame.new(0, 0, -20), true)

searchDocs.title: CustomTween​
searchDocs.content: since 1.0.0 </> TweenModule.CustomTween( target: Instance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, properties: {[string]: any}, callback?: (() → nil) ) → TweenHandle Tweens a given instance with specified properties and optional completion callback. Example: local Handle = TweenModule.CustomTween(workspace.Part, "QuadInOut:2", { Transparency = 1, Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0), }, function() print("Tween finished!") end) Handle.Pause() -- Pauses the tween task.wait(1) Handle.Resume() -- Resumes the tween

searchDocs.title: ChainTween​
searchDocs.content: since 2.0.0 </> TweenModule.ChainTween( tweens: {{ instance: Instance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, props: {[string]: any} }},-- A list of tween configs to apply in sequence. onComplete: (() → nil)?-- Optional callback function called after all tweens complete. ) → () Chains multiple tweens to play one after another in sequence. Example: TweenModule.ChainTween({ { instance = workspace.Part1, tweenInfo = "SineOut:1", props = { Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0) }, }, { instance = workspace.Part2, tweenInfo = "SineIn:1", props = { Position = Vector3.new(0, 0, 0) }, }, }, function() print("Chain finished!") end)

searchDocs.title: Transparency​
searchDocs.content: since 1.0.0 </> TweenModule.Transparency( target: PVInstance ,-- The instance (Model, BasePart, or Folder) whose BaseParts' transparency will be affected. tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string,-- The TweenInfo.new() settings or a string profile (e.g. "SineOut:1.5"). Transparency: number-- The target transparency value between 0 and 1. ) → () Tweens the transparency of all BaseParts in a target. Example: TweenModule.Transparency(workspace.Model, "QuadInOut:0.5", 1)

searchDocs.title: TweenTag​
searchDocs.content: since 2.0.0 </> TweenModule.TweenTag( tag: string, tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, properties: {[string]: any}, callback?: (() → nil) ) → () Tweens all instances with a specific CollectionService tag using the provided tween settings and property goals. Example: TweenModule.TweenTag("HighlightParts", "BackInOut:1.2", { Transparency = 0.25 }, function() print("All tagged parts have finished tweening.") end)

searchDocs.title: Shake​
searchDocs.content: since 1.0.0 </> TweenModule.Shake( target: PVInstance , duration: number,-- The total time in seconds the shake lasts (-1 for infinite shake) intensity: number,-- How strong the shake is (higher = more jitter). individually: boolean-- If true, shakes each BasePart individually; otherwise, shakes the entire model via pivot ) → () → ()-- A function that can be called to manually stop the shake. Applies a shaking effect to a PVInstance for a set duration and intensity. Example: local StopShake = TweenModule.Shake(workspace.Model, 2, 6, true) -- Will shake the model for 2 seconds with intensity 6 and each part individually. -- Stop early after 1 second task.delay(1, function() StopShake() end)

searchDocs.title: Scale​
searchDocs.content: since 1.0.0 </> TweenModule.Scale( target: PVInstance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string,-- The tween settings or a string profile (e.g., "SineOut:1.5"). scaleTo: Vector3 , adjustPosition: boolean,-- If true, adjusts each part’s position to compensate for scaling. scaledByModel: boolean-- If true, scales the whole model using pivot math. Requires target:IsA("Model"). ) → () Scales a PVInstance's BaseParts by a Vector3 value, optionally adjusting position. Example: -- Scale up each part in a folder by (2, 2, 2) and shift positions TweenModule.Scale(workspace.BuildingParts, "InOutQuad:1.25", Vector3.new(2, 2, 2), true, false) -- Uniformly scale a model from its pivot point TweenModule.Scale(workspace.CarModel, "SineOut:1.5", Vector3.new(1.2, 1.2, 1.2), false, true)

searchDocs.title: Color​
searchDocs.content: since 1.1.1 </> TweenModule.Color( target: PVInstance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, ColorTo: Color3 | BrickColor | string-- The target color (can be Color3, BrickColor, or hex string like "#ff0040") ) → () Animates the color of all BaseParts within a PVInstance to a target color. Example: -- Tween to bright red using a string profile TweenModule.Color(workspace.Model, "QuadOut:1", "#ff0040") -- Tween to BrickColor TweenModule.Color(workspace.Model, "QuadOut:1", BrickColor.new("Bright red")) -- Tween to Color3 directly TweenModule.Color(workspace.Model, "QuadOut:1", Color3.fromRGB(0, 255, 150))

searchDocs.title: Pulse​
searchDocs.content: </> TweenModule.Pulse( target: PVInstance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, ...: Color3 | BrickColor | string ) → () Creates a color pulse animation on a PVInstance, transitioning through multiple colors in sequence using the same tween info. Example: TweenModule.Pulse(workspace.Model, "SineOut:0.5:2:false:0.25", "#FF0000", BrickColor.new("Bright blue"), Color3.fromRGB(0, 255, 0))

searchDocs.title: Rotate​
searchDocs.content: since 1.0.0 </> TweenModule.Rotate( target: PVInstance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, rotation: Vector3 ,-- The rotation in degrees (X, Y, Z). byPivot: boolean-- If true, rotates around the current pivot point. ) → () Rotates a PVInstance (Model, Folder, or BasePart) using tweens. Example: TweenModule.Rotate(workspace.MyModelIWantRotatedNOW, "SineOut:1", Vector3.new(0, 90, 0), true)

searchDocs.title: SequenceTween​
searchDocs.content: since 1.1.0 </> TweenModule.SequenceTween( target: Instance , tweenInfo: TweenInfo | string, properties: {[string]: any},-- Table of properties to tween. Supports Color, Transparency, CurveSize0, CurveSize1. universal: boolean-- If true, recursively applies to all Beams inside the target. ) → () Animates properties of Beams or their descendants using NumberSequence or ColorSequence with easing. Use this function with caution! This function has only been tested with Beams and their properties. Other instances may not work as expected but will be continuously worked on if any issues arise. Example: -- Animate all beams in a model to fade transparency over 2 seconds TweenModule.SequenceTween(workspace.MyBeamGroup, "SineOut:2", { Transparency = NumberSequence.new(1) }, true) -- Animate a single beam's color TweenModule.SequenceTween(myBeam, "QuadIn:1.5", { Color = ColorSequence.new(Color3.new(1, 0, 0)) }, false)

searchDocs.title: PauseAll​
searchDocs.content: </> TweenModule.PauseAll() → () Pauses all currently running tweens tracked by TweenModule.

searchDocs.title: ResumeAll​
searchDocs.content: </> TweenModule.ResumeAll() → () Resumes all paused tweens tracked by TweenModule.

searchDocs.title: CancelAll​
searchDocs.content: </> TweenModule.CancelAll() → () Cancels and cleans up all active tweens managed by TweenModule.
